meanings.definition: Sculches (verb): to move clumsily or awkwardly
meanings.sent1: She sculches around the room, bumping into furniture.
meanings.sent2: The toddler sculches across the floor, trying to stand up.
meanings.sent3: The penguin sculches on the ice, slipping and sliding comically.
meanings.sent4: His attempt to dance was like watching a robot sculch through the steps.
meanings.sent5: The old car sculches along the bumpy road, barely moving forward.

meanings.definition: Sculches (noun): a clumsy or awkward movement
meanings.sent1: Her sculches were evident as she tripped over her own feet.
meanings.sent2: The sculches of the puppy made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent3: The sculches of the clown entertained the children at the party.
meanings.sent4: The sculches of the robot on stage were deliberate and amusing.
meanings.sent5: The sculches of the ducklings following their mother were adorable to watch.

meanings.definition: Sculches (adjective): awkward or clumsy in movement or appearance
meanings.sent1: He felt sculches in his body after the long hike.
meanings.sent2: The sculches movements of the scarecrow made it look funny.
meanings.sent3: The sculches outfit she wore to the party drew attention.
meanings.sent4: The sculches walk of the zombie was eerie in the dim light.
meanings.sent5: The sculches handwriting on the note made it hard to read.
